title.value: Popular and Scientific Discourse on Autism: Representational Cross-Cultural Analysis of Epistemic Communities to Inform Policy and Practice
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Popular and Scientific Discourse on Autism: Representational Cross-Cultural Analysis of Epistemic Communities to Inform Policy and Practice

extractions.description: This paper explores trends in health information about autism spectrum disorder by semantically analyzing big data gathered from Twitter and PubMed. It focuses on the comparison between popular representations found on social media and scientific representations in literature to highlight different focus areas.

type.justification: The study uses data from Twitter and PubMed, applying natural language processing techniques and topic modeling, indicating an empirical approach.
type.quote: This study explores the trends in health information about autism spectrum disorder within popular and scientific communities through the systematic semantic exploration of big data gathered from Twitter and PubMed.

name.justification: The paper employs techniques such as text-mining analysis and unsupervised machine learning topic modeling, which are key methods within the field of Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: Methods: First, we performed a natural language processing by text-mining analysis and with unsupervised (machine learning) topic modeling on a sample of the last 10,000 tweets in English posted with the term #autism.

name.justification: The study analyzes data from Twitter, making it a significant part of Social Media Analysis.
name.quote: Social media provide a window onto the circulation of ideas in everyday folk psychiatry, revealing the themes and issues discussed both by the public and by various scientific communities.

name.justification: The paper discusses implications for healthcare policy based on the findings from the analyzed datasets.
name.quote: Our study can inform policy makers on the health and social needs and concerns of individuals with autism and their caregivers, especially to define health indicators based on important issues for beneficiaries.
